sentence.Network_en: Thoreau viewed man as an inextricable part of nature.
sentence.Network_cn: 梭罗认为人是自然不可分割的一部分。

sentence.Network_en: To Henry David Thoreau the answer is a decisive and resounding " No "!
sentence.Network_cn: 对亨利-大卫-梭罗来说,这个问题的回答是一个坚决而响亮的 “ 不 ”!

sentence.Network_en: You should take note of the mode of Thoreau's resistance to government.
sentence.Network_cn: 应该注意梭罗抵制政府的方式.

Sentence.sentence: When telegraphs and trains brought in the idea that convenience was more important than content, Henry David Thoreau reminded us that'.
